translation.Lost in Desert.narration:
The blowing, hot wind scorches the
surface of both the earth and your
skin as you walk aimlessly in the
desert, thirsty for water.
<break time='0.5s'/><audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo/Heavy_footsteps_01.mp3'/>
You've reached the top of a little
sand hill. It grants you some height
advantage and now you can see what's
around you.
translation.Tutorial.narration: You can say, look left or look right.
translation.Tutorial.reprompt: You can say, look left or look right.
translation.Look Right.narration:
There's nothing special to your right
except the endless desert. Wait! You
see a few freckles on the yellow
surface of Earth.
<break time='0.5s'/>
It shines under the burning sun!
You squint your eyes and look closer.
it's a small town! There might be
water there.
<break time='0.5s'/>
You can go to a place by saying go to that place. Try saying go to the town.
translation.Go to Town.narration: Quick! There might be water there.
translation.Town.narration:
The urge of cold water passing through
dry lungs has dragged your weary feet
to the entrance of the town. You
thought the townspeople would step
forward immediately to help a thirsty
traveler, but instead...
<break time='0.5s'/>
No-one came. What's happening?
<break time='0.5s'/>
At any moment, you can ask to check
the environment. Try saying: "what's
around me?"
translation.Town.reprompt:
At any moment, you can ask to check
the environment. Try saying: "what's
around me?"
translation.Around.narration:
You're at the entrance of the town. 
Some small buildings align on the 
sides of the street, but all of their 
doors are shut tight. Only a few 
people are walking on the streets, but 
it's almost as if they're trying to 
avoid having any eye-contact with you.
<break time='0.5s'/>
There are a few establishments right 
in front of you: a general store, the 
mayor's office. Could any of them have 
some water? Choose a location to go to.
translation.Around.reprompt:
There are a few establishments right 
in front of you: a general store, the 
mayor's office. Could any of them have 
some water? Choose a location to go to.
translation.Store.narration:
Upon approaching the general store,
you see a boy. He wears a red coat,
and you can see "surprised"
written all over his face.
<break time='0.5s'/><voice name='Justin'>
You are a new face here. Do you need
help? You don't look well.</voice>
<break time='0.5s'/>
Maybe he has water. You can probably
ask if there's water. When you need something, you can say "ask for something". Try saying "ask for water"
translation.Boy.narration:
You asked the boy for some water. <voice name='Justin'>
I can help you with that. But I must 
warn you- that situations in the house 
aren't exactly desirable.</voice>
The boy takes you around the building 
and enters the store from the 
backdoor.
<break time='0.5s'/>
Oh dear it was far from being 
desirable. The air in the store was 
nothing of this world. It's foul and 
revolting. Each step you take is like 
a deeper dive into the bowels of a 
carnivorous beast.
<break time='0.5s'/><voice name='Justin'>
Yeah. Told you. Papa!</voice>
The boy calls his father to come 
downstairs.
translation.Shopkeeper.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>
Who is this person? Why did you bring  
a stranger that looks like a dying 
cactus to this place?</voice> 
<voice name='Justin'> 
Relax, papa. He's just a traveler. And  
he needs water. A lot of water.</voice> 
<voice name='Brian'> 
Water? Hah! I got lots of water. As if  
water would do anything to wash this  
stench away.</voice> 
<break time='0.5s'/> 
The young boy's father handed you a  
big glass of water. 
<voice name='Brian'> 
Hey- don't worry. I know it smells bad  
in here. But I assure you, the water is clean.</voice> 
<break time='0.5s'/> 
Sometimes when appropriate, you can  
use an item. Since the father handed  
you a glass of water, you can try saying,  
"drink water".
translation.Finding Out.narration:
The father has given you his word that
the water is clean for drinking. But
even without his promise you'd still
chug the whole glass of water,
bottoms-up.
<break time='0.5s'/>
The desert in your body is no more.
Right now it is a lagoon of spring
water, cool splashes of comfort
travels to every corner of your body,
like ice on melting lava. It's almost
as if you could hear the hiss.
<voice name='Brian'>
Feel better? You really looked like
the desert's going to get you.</voice>
Now it's just the stench that's really
giving you a headache.
<break time='0.5s'/>
<voice name='Brian'>Sorry for the bad manners back there.
It's just this town has never since a
single visitor for a long time. Not
after the incident.</voice>
You can talk to him by saying “talk to the shopkeeper”
translation.Finding Out.reprompt: You can talk to him by saying talk to the shopkeeper
translation.Ask Shopkeeper.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>while ago the town was famed
for our Ambrosia. People would come
all the way from cities to this desert town
for a taste of it
<break time='0.5s'/>
So traveler, what brings you here?</voice>
translation.Ask for Help.narration:
<break time='4s'/><voice name='Brian'>
Hmm, interesting reason to make you 
come here. Anyways, this is a desert 
so you could imagine it never rains 
here- until that night.
<break time='0.5s'/>
On that night. We've seen the greatest
thunderstorm of the town's history,
but no-one anticipated what came
after.</voice>
<voice name='Justin'>
And then the next morning, my dad
started sweating like a cow. So did
everyone else. But not me.</voice>
<voice name='Brian'>
Yeah. We were like broken
faucets. But what's worse was what
happens afterwards- that's right. the
stench. This stench. It kept everyone
from talking to each other. It drove
tourists away. And now, no-one wants
to come to our town anymore.</voice>
<break time='0.5s'/>
The shopkeeper points to a poster on
the left wall. It has some dust and
the colors have started to fade away,
but it's still pretty clear.
<voice name='Brian'>
The mayor believed that it's a curse.
He was trying to find people to help.
Even set up a great reward for anyone
who lifts the curse.
<break time='0.5s'/>
Say, since you're here, why don't you
help us? There's a lucrative treasure,
and it could be all yours. In the
meantime, you can look around the
store. No worries.</voice>
It seems like they really need your help.
translation.Ask for Help.reprompt: It seems like they really need your help.
translation.Other Buildings.narration: The mayor's office is closed today. Do you want to go to the general store instead?
translation.Look Front Left Behind.narration:
Except the blurry horizon infinitely far away 
and the endless yellow, there's 
nothing special that catches your 
attention.
translation.Decide to Help.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>
	    Ha-haaah! This is our lucky day, son. Finally a person who is willing to help us. Well, I guess I shouldn't be keeping here for too long, eh? </voice>
		<voice name='Justin'> 
		But papa, you haven't told him anything about how to solve the problem. </voice>
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		Huh? Oh wait...Ah, yes, yes, yes. Must've been the heat and the stench, now I'm just rusty. Rusty! </voice>
		The shopkeeper scratches his bald head. 
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		Yes... about where the problem is... hmmmm... let me think... </voice>
		<voice name='Justin'> 
		Papa, do you really know what the problem is? </voice>
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		Ahh. Well, I've only heard stories and tales, but I guess I should let you know. </voice>
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		So it all happened on one night... </voice>
		<voice name='Justin'> 
		You've already said that. </voice>
		<voice name='Brian'>
		Oh have I? Oh yes, yes. Anyways, legend has it that a mysterious stone is the key ingredient of lifting this curse. It also says that it's buried deep in the a secret cavern in the valleys to the East. <break time='0.5s'/> Anyways, this is all I have. I know it's not much... hey, perhaps you can go ask if the mayor knows anything more. After all, he's the who put up this poster. Maybe he knows more.</voice>
		<voice name='Justin'> 
		But the mayor is also locking himself up. No-one has seen him for a while. </voice>
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		Ha! This, my son, is when being the owner of the ONLY general store in the town comes in handy-- Kungh kungh, you see, the mayor has a secret craving for Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce. And guess who's selling it? Me! Ha haaah! </voice>
		Ask for one, or ask more about the sauce.
translation.One Bottle of Sauce.narration:
<voice name='Brian'> 
        One bottle of Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce, coming right up! </voice>
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/findingThings1.mp3'/>
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        Hmmm, where is it? </voice>
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/findingThings2.mp3'/>
        <voice name='Justin'> 
        Dad, didn't you just sell one to the Mrs. Chilirosa yesterday? </voice>
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        Hmm, Oh yes, yes! I did sold one to her. Oh dear. I guess that's our last bottle in a while. Next batch is not coming in a week, and I need to drive all the way out of town to get it because they can't stand our stench! </voice>
        <voice name='Justin'> 
        Stop murmuring, dad. Anyways, if you go ask Mrs. Chilirosa, she might have still have some left for you.</voice>
        Now you can leave the store, or ask more about Mrs.Chilirosa.
translation.Ask more about Chilirosa.narration:
<voice name='Brian'> 
        She's a stubborn old lady who works at the hair salon down the street. Like the mayor, she also has a craving for spicy things. </voice>
        <voice name='Justin'> 
        Yeah! All my friends who visited her shop came out with hair that smelled spicy for days! </voice>
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        But I know what she also likes. As funny as it may sound, she also likes roses. But I doubt you'll be finding any of them around. Not in this desert.</voice>
        Now you can leave the store, or ask again
translation.Leave the Store.narration:
Just as you are about to leave the store, the shopkeeper stops you.
        <voice name='Brian'>
        Wait wait. The desert is hot and wide. Don't want you to starve or get thirsty out there. Take these.</voice>
        The shopkeeper gives you a big bread and a full canteen of water. They both look edible, but at the same time the stench attaches to them. 
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/doorOpen1.mp3'/>
        You step out of the store.
translation.The Cross.narration: There are a few things that you may want to check: A signpost, the mayor's office to your left, or you can go find the beauty salon.
translation.Signpost.narration: You come forward to the signpost across the lonely street. There are a few items on it. It reads: the right leads to the mayor's office, Chilirosa's Beauty Salon, and the Eastern exit of the town. You've also noticed that there are a few strings of ivy tangling around the signpost. They look surprisingly healthy.
translation.Mayor's Office.narration:
You arrived at the mayor's office. It's the seemingly largest building in the town, and it's doors are shut tight and locked. Beside the door is a trash can full of empty bottles. 
        <break time='0.5s'/>
        Now you can: Knock, bash, or try to open the door, check out the trash can, or go to another location.
translation.Knock On Mayor's Office.narration: You knocked on the door, but nobody answers.
translation.Bash On Mayor's Office.narration: You bashed heavily on the door, but nothing happened.
translation.Check Out the Trash Can.narration: You checked out the trash can, but it's empty.
translation.Beauty Salon.narration:
You started walking towards the end of the street.
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/windBlowing1.mp3'/>
        Nothing but the sandy gusts of wind blow into your ears. No-one is visible on the street. The buildings on the way look pretty modern, but they are all coated with a thick layer of dust. While you're on your way, you noticed something peculiar in the corner of one of the buildings. It's a patch of green. 
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/footsteps2.mp3'/>
translation.Arrive Beauty Salon.narration:
You've now arrived at Chilirosa's Beauty Salon. It's clearly outdated design makes it stand out from other establishments on the street.
        Now you can: Knock on the door, bash on the door, open the door directly, or check on the green patch before.
translation.Knock On Beauty Salon.narration:
You gently knocked on the door.
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/flowfootsteps.mp3'/>
         <voice name="Kimberly">
        Alright, alright, coming.</voice>
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/doorOpen2.mp3'/>
translation.Bash On Beauty Salon.narration:
You bashed on the door.
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/peopleWalkingFast.mp3'/>
         <voice name="Kimberly">
        Show some respect! Don't you have any manners?</voice>
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/doorOpen2.mp3'/>
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa with flower.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Oh, my! Is THAT for me?</voice>
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa with flower.recap:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        I believe it is for me, right?</voice>
translation.Give Mrs Chilirosa the flower.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Why, thank you, dear... What's your name? </voice>
        <amazon:effect name="whispered">say your name!</amazon:effect>.
translation.Answer Your Name.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Oh, thank you, dear {playerName}. Come in, come in. We've haven't had guests in quite a while. </voice>
        Mrs. Chilirosa smells the rose with all her breath. 
         <voice name="Kimberly">
        Ho, ho, ho, what a wonderful smell. Now, tell me, dear, what kind of hairstyle are we looking for today? </voice>
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa.narration: Now, it's time to tell her about the sauce. You can try to say "Ask about the sauce".
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa.reprompt: She is waiting for your response, just say:"Ask about the sauce"
translation.Meet Mrs Chilirosa.recap: You can try to say "Ask about the sauce".
translation.Ask about the Sauce.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Ah yes, the Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce. I can't eat with out it. It's my fountain of life. I need it for my breakfast, lunch and supper! People don't understand the beauty of the sauce, but that's ok! That means I'll only have to share it with the few that understands. Ho, ho, ho! But, you see, it's kind of hard to get it around this area, so I just wanted to ask why you needed the sauce. </voice>
        So we have two plans here: Plan A, You tell her how you like the sauce; Plan B, tell her that you need it to get the mayor's attention. Which plan you wanna go?
translation.Ask about the Sauce.recap: We have two plans here: Plan A, You tell her how you like the sauce; Plan B, tell her that you need it to get the mayor's attention. Which plan you wanna go?
translation.utterance-tell her how I like the sauce: tell her how I like the sauce
translation.utterance-tell her that I need it to get: tell her that I need it to get the mayor's attention
translation.Tell Mrs Chilirose you like the Sauce.na:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Oh! Really? but why? </voice>
        Ok. Now make up a good reason why you like the sauce. You can say the sentence start with <break time='0.5s'/>"My reason is"
translation.Tell Mrs Chilirose you like the Sauce.re: Ok. Now make up a good reason why you like the sauce. You can say the sentence start with <break time='0.5s'/>"My reason is"
Now make up a good reason why you like the sauce. You can say the sentence start with <break time='0.5s'/>"My reason is"
<voice name="Kimberly">
        I can't believe it! It's another friend who appreciates Super-Duper Sauce like I do! Ho, ho, ho! Today has been the best day in years! Here. You can have the rest. </voice>
        She gleefully hands over the hot sauce to you. You exit the building.
translation.Tell Mrs Chilirose Honestly.narration:
<voice name="Kimberly">
        Hmmm. I see. Truly, the town isn't seeing anyone over these years, just because of this smell. Ew! It reminds me of exactly someone who had this smell a few years back. Anyways, if I can help you get rid of this smell, I'll help however I can. Here, take it.</voice>
        She hands over the hot sauce to you. You exit the building.
translation.Open the Beauty Salon Directly.narration: you tried to open the door directly, but it's not opening
translation.check the Green Patch.narration: You walk back to the patch of green sitting in the corner of a building. Oh dear, in a dry desert like this, you found a rose with a bright red color on it. You pick up the rose and hold it in your hand.
translation.Get the Hot Sauce.narration:
Now you have the hot sauce. You can try getting the mayor's attention. But how?
        Wave to the window on the streets? Or shout at the mayor?
translation.Get the Hot Sauce.reprompt: What should we do? Wave to the window on the streets? Or shout at the mayor?
translation.Get the Hot Sauce.recap: Wave to the window on the streets? Or shout at the mayor?
translation.Wave To the Window.narration: You waved to the window, but nothing happened.
translation.Shout At the Mayor.narration:
Ok then. Shout something loud and clear so that the mayor can hear you. You have 4 seconds to do that. Now let's shout!
        [LongLongPause]
        <audio src='s3://koetest/new_demo_stereo/openWindows.mp3'/>
        <voice name="Joey">
        Who's shouting?! Did I just hear Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce!</voice>
        The mayor finds you below his window. 
        <voice name="Joey"> 
        Say, you said you have super-duper hot blue sauce? Come in! Door's unlocked. Remember to shut the door on your way in! </voice>
        You enter the mayor's office, and shut the door swiftly as come indoors. There is a different smell in this house. You don't smell the stench anymore; rather, it is replaced with the strong, spicy scent of the hot sauce. As you make your way to the mayor's room, you find that hot sauce is being spilled all over the place. Hallways, corners and especially under doors. 
        <audio src='s3://koetest/new_demo_stereo/doorOpen1.mp3'/>
        <voice name="Joey">
        Ah. Welcome. I see that you've brought some hot sauce for me?</voice>
        You hand over the sauce. The mayor quickly jerks open the bottle cap, and walks hastily to one of the doors and pours the sauce under it. 
        <voice name="Joey">
        You see. I actually don't like the sauce. I use it only to block off smell. This fog of evilness has been surrounding this town for so long that I almost forgot when it happened. Say, why did you come?</voice>
        Let me see... you come here because you need more information on the smell. right?
translation.Shout At the Mayor.reprompt: You come here because you need more information on the smell. right?
translation.Shout At the Mayor.recap: Wait, you come here because you need more information on the smell. right?
translation.Agree to Help the Mayor.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Wait. Are you saying that you're willing to help us get rid of this disgusting smell? Oh please, sit down, sit down.[/Accnet End] 
        You sit down on the old couch in the mayor's office. The couch releases a spicy smell that stings. 
        <voice name="Joey"> 
        So, the legend out there says there's a precious gem hidden in the valleys to the East, and that the precious gem is the key ingredient to lifting the curse. </voice>
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/windBlowing2.mp3'/>
        <voice name="Joey">
        What the don't know, is that the cavern is guarded by puzzles and challenges. But what's beyond that- nobody knows. Nobody remembers.</voice>
translation.Ask the Mayor.narration: You can ask about how he knows all this, about the cave, or about the town itself.
translation.Ask the Mayor.recap: Well, the options are: A. ask about how he knows all this; B. ask about the cave; C. ask about the town it self.
translation.Ask Mayor How He knows.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        A while ago we sent our best people to go and retrieve the stone. When they returned, they were covered in smell even nastier than what we have in the town. But what's worse was that they could barely remember anything. The doctor said that probably the smell was too unbearable that they passed out at some point and lost all the memory. This is all they could remember.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Well, there's not much to talk about the cave, other than it's hidden in the valleys to the East... wait. Ah, yes, nearly missed this: It is said that there were plant roots that lead into the cave. A real miracle since green is sparse in the desert.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        We were once a happy little town in the desert. At one point it even became a tourist spot! It's crazy to think that people would come from everywhere, just to get a taste of our famous dish, Shawarma.</voice>
        Do you want to continue on this subject? Or ask him about something else?
translation.Ask Mayor The Town.recap: You can answer yes or no. Do you want to continue on this subject?
translation.Continue Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
        Speaking of which, this reminds me of a character, yes, quite a character in our town. </voice>
        The mayor pauses to sip a cup of water. He also spreads some of the hot sauce on his nose. 
        <voice name="Joey"> 
        We had this guy who worked in one of the most famous Shawarma places in town. Everything was normal except he sweats a lot, and a lot. It's like he wasn't born for the desert. </voice>
        The hot sauce made the mayor to sweat a little bit, as he tries to wipe of some of them from his cheeks.
        <voice name="Joey">
        But it doesn't just stop there. Oh dear, he has this odor. It was offending the guests. A great embarrassment. </voice>
        The mayor leans back and waves his hands while he talks. 
        <voice name="Joey"> So, in the end, we had to make him leave. That's just a story. I don't know if anyone has hired him again, but that was just some time before this smell found its way into the town. </voice>
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.narration: and you can also heave for the cave.
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.recap: Well, the options are: A. leave for the cave; B. ask mayor about something else
translation.Leave the Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey">
            I hope that these information are useful to you. We're all looking forward to seeing the town coming back to life some day. Good luck! </voice>
        You leave the mayor's office, back on to the streets. As you head East for you journeys, you look back again at the small town, still suffering from the bad smell. You also see the boy from the general store waving at you as you stretch into the horizon in the East.
translation.More Sauce.narration: The shopkeeper seems not happy about that, maybe we should ask for one bottle for this time?
